document_data.name: Smallpox
document_data.mainbody: '''Smallpox''' was a mundane infectious [[disease]].{{Cite polyhedron/132/City Stories: Mother's Cupboard|14}} It was regarded as one of the most dangerous non-[[magic]]al diseases.
document_data.Effects: Sufferers' skin became covered in pockmarks, not unlike the scars left by the [[spotted plague]]. The disease was fatal if left untreated.
document_data.Treatment:
It was possible to treat smallpox by non-magical means, although such care often took as many as 12 days{{Cite dragon/269/Herbcraft|39}} Such services were offered at [[Mother's Cupboard]], an [[apothecary]] in [[Raven's Bluff]], who treated diseases of those who wished to avoid temples. The proprietor, "Mother" [[Josselyn Phelia]], charged 50 [[gp]] per day of care as of the mid-to-late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].

The [[halfling]]s of [[Luiren]] had developed a special skill of medicinal cooking that involved making curative foods using [[Luiren spring cheese]], and experienced cooks knew how to prepare meals that could cure many otherwise fatal normal diseases, including smallpox.
